Portal 2 - одно из тех продолжений, которое обскакивает качество первой части во много раз. Больше головоломок и реиграбельность в виде карт сообщества. Гениальная задумка, хороший и слегка запутанный сюжет, красивый графоний (даже на сегодняшний день). Все эти факторы создают шЭдЭЭвр!
Короче, 12 из 10 и если жизнь даёт вам лимоны, не делайте лимонад, ребята.

El juego es exageradamente bueno una obra maestra ahora nos dan un nuevo modo de juego y puedes compartir mapas con la comunidad lo que hace el tiempo de juego casi infinito es increible ademas de que esta muy barato pero es recomendado tener un amigo y decirle que se lo compre para el cooperativo ya que una partida con desconocidos puede llegar a ser toxica y molesta  es uno de estos juegos que te deja hacer muchas cosas puedes jugar la historia principal hablar con un amigo para invitarlo a jugar para conseguir logros pasar la historia o pueden trollearse mutuamente con las pruebas y si no quieres puedes ver los videos o el trailer de super 8 y si ya hiciste todo puedesd continuar jugando los mapas de la comunidad encerio lo recomiendo mi calificacion: 10/10

Probabilmente il miglior gioco puzzle di sempre. Livelli originali e creativi, accompagnati da una storia carina. Oltre alla modalità storia anche una modalità coop (molto più breve) con livelli fatti apposta per essere giocati in coop. Infine ha anche il supporto per il workshop dove si possono trovare un'infinità di livelli. Consigliato anche per chi non ama i giochi puzzle, questo è un must play.

Amazing puzzle game with a well-written story and hilarious dialogue. 
After all these years, it's still a fun game and worth buying, even in 2020.

Portal 2 was a delightful sequel to the original Portal game that I believe could not have been made with less quality. Not only is the foreshadowing brilliant, but the entire story and backstory that is revealed through this game just adds so much to the universe that is built around the Portal and Half-life Games. I enjoyed this game quite a bit and would recommend it.

[h1] [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/38770110/] Follow my curator page for various in-depth reviews on other games! [/url] [/h1]

Not sure why I'm even reviewing this, because I'm pretty sure almost everybody knows about this game, but here we go anyways. Portal 2 is a steadily paced story-driven first-person 3D puzzle platformer in which you navigate through a massive facility with mechanical parts and machines galore. The factory is owned by what the player can assume is a robotics conglomerate called Aperture Science Laboratories. It takes place in the same world as Half-Life and can even be considered a continuation of not only Portal, but the Half-Life saga as well. 

You play as Chell, a silent female protagonist and are guided by two robots. The first robot you meet is named Wheatley and the premise of the story at that time is to escape and enter the real world. When that plan fails, you are reintroduced to GLaDOS, (which is an acronym for Genetic Lifeform and Disk Operating System) who you initially destroyed in the first Portal. Wheatley makes multiple attempts to contact you while you go through GLaDOS' tests, and once two bodies are switched the story takes a more sinister turn that I won't be describing so I don't spoil it for you. 

The story is pretty much all dialogue narrated by whatever robot you're with, or prerecorded human voices if you find yourself alone. The game is heavily focused on solving "tests" or puzzles, and not too much platforming is involved in my opinion. Luckily, the tests never feel tedious or too difficult to solve, although they can be a little confusing. You can expect to see enemies that take part in some of these tests (like turrets) or if not that you'll encounter lasers. You can die during these tests, so be careful. 

There is a cooperative mode to play with friends, but I haven't tried that yet, so I won't be mentioning it elsewhere. Overall this is a nice little game with an intriguing (and sometimes comedic) story that everybody seems to enjoy. It's well worth the price, and if you like games that make you use your head, you'll enjoy Portal 2. Edit: Just finished the game and the ending is really cool. Should take about 7-9 hours to complete.

I cannot believe I have played this game for 100 hours+. Portal community is one of the best when it comes to creativity. All the solo and coop maps are absolute head-scratcher and I can spend hours with my friend trying to complete one by one whether it is Digital Realm or The Order of Things. Your brain goes 10000% when you complete even 1 room of their chambers. P.s. Atlas and Peabody are great.
The campaign mode is also really fun and a good sequel for portal. It is a long tutorial for the community test chambers. The puzzle rooms from the devs are huge and feels trap at the same time. All in all a great masterpiece from Valve.
